data.title: [THE OFFICIAL] Super Junior (슈퍼주니어) Thread #4
data.text:
My opinion on the Hankyung situation:

This isn't exactly his fault. But neither is he completely innocent. I've always been in the group of people who felt somewhat betrayed by the lawsuit, but decided to support him in his endeavors anyway. It's been almost a year and the issue almost seems to have died down, with an almost peaceful atmosphere on both sides. Hankyung tries not to talk about SME more than he has to (but reporters are nosy, of course), and I've yet to see him "badmouth" SME, SJ, or Korea. He does indeed criticize the management and recount times where he felt he was mistreated, but he always finishes off by saying he does not regret his time in Korea and that he's thankful for the opportunity SM gave him. He's been respectful in that aspect at least.

However, the recent CF controversy has been somewhat of a disappointment. It's true it was originally filmed in Chinese, and that the reason for the Korean dub was irrelevent, this whole mess was handled rather badly. Everyone ought to know how Hankyung is inextricably linked to any references of Korea by now, and how sensitive the issue is. Either they shouldn't have dubbed it, or they shouldn't have chosen him as the model. He himself should have realized the implications of the CF. Even if he didn't mean to offend on purpose, I dont think anyone should be surprised by the reaction the CF got. And so, even though Hankyung didn't do anything explicitly wrong, he should still make a public statement or apology to clear the mess up. If not for his benefit, then for the fans he left back in Korea, who at the moment are feeling used. Hankyung is too caring to have just forgotten about everyone who helped build him up to this moment. Or at least, I hope he is.

On another note...

Oh god, the Kangin pictures. I think I'm about to cry. He looks SO GOOD! He's really lost a lot of weight and he just seems so much brighter and healthier and... oh... *sniffle*

I miss you so much T-T

My opinion on the Hankyung situation:

This isn't exactly his fault. But neither is he completely innocent. I've always been in the group of people who felt somewhat betrayed by the lawsuit, but decided to support him in his endeavors anyway. It's been almost a year and the issue almost seems to have died down, with an almost peaceful atmosphere on both sides. Hankyung tries not to talk about SME more than he has to (but reporters are nosy, of course), and I've yet to see him "badmouth" SME, SJ, or Korea. He does indeed criticize the management and recount times where he felt he was mistreated, but he always finishes off by saying he does not regret his time in Korea and that he's thankful for the opportunity SM gave him. He's been respectful in that aspect at least.

However, the recent CF controversy has been somewhat of a disappointment. It's true it was originally filmed in Chinese, and that the reason for the Korean dub was irrelevent, this whole mess was handled rather badly. Everyone ought to know how Hankyung is inextricably linked to any references of Korea by now, and how sensitive the issue is. Either they shouldn't have dubbed it, or they shouldn't have chosen him as the model. He himself should have realized the implications of the CF. Even if he didn't mean to offend on purpose, I dont think anyone should be surprised by the reaction the CF got. And so, even though Hankyung didn't do anything explicitly wrong, he should still make a public statement or apology to clear the mess up. If not for his benefit, then for the fans he left back in Korea, who at the moment are feeling used. Hankyung is too caring to have just forgotten about everyone who helped build him up to this moment. Or at least, I hope he is.

Agree. As of now, though i wont say i have been following Hangeng's every activities, but in my memory, i have not seen a vid or read anything abt him badmouthing sm or korea. if any, he credited what's of his current accomplishments to sm as well. so, he's definitely not ungrateful, if that's what some of us here are thinking or implying.

im not pleased with the "hype" around the cf now as well.

and i hope, an action will be taken soon and pls, i hope the management wont place this as those that will die down after some time cause i dont think this will given the sensitivity of the issue.

and besides, i think it's only reasonable that Hangeng make a statement(apology) of some sort to the fans who have been supporting him, especially in Korea.

--

^

Heechul's tweets make me smile.

why is he soooooo ridiculously adorably random ?

and i have managed to get 4 tickets for the SS3 in Singapore,

it's mosh pit though... and i have no idea what to expect from that ....

And it was clarified that the CF WAS originally in chinese,but then the CF dubbed the women...I dun know whether this was done why the advertising company or by those anti...And you guys can go to allkpop for more details.

I understand that as Hankyung fans, we all want to protect him against any criticism even our own (which is why I haven't said a single thing in the past 11 months about it since the lawsuit took place... until now), but come on. Dubbed by anti's?? Why did the CF folks give a response to the controversy and explain about the dubb if they didn't do it?

But even if we say that the CF was dubbed and Hankyung didn't know it was going to be dubbed when it was filmed, there is no way to claim that Hankyung was unaware of the premise of the CF. The banner ON STAGE in the CF is in Korean. To say that Hankyung, who has lived in Korea for over 5 years, couldn't tell the difference between Korean and Chinese writing would be ridiculous. Going on a set, knowing that the general idea of the CF was about an angry and put-upon employee revolting against his boss and the set has Korean writing??? You'd have to be a complete moron not to know what the CF was trying to imply.

As an aside, the LAST PLACE ON EARTH I'd go for more details of any kind is allkpop. They don't have the best track record for accurate reporting of Korean news.

On a happier note, the SBS PowerFM concert MCed by Heechul....

http://www.artsnews.co.kr/news/116652

New SM The Ballad photo.

Preview of S.M. The Ballad’s First Album To Be Released

Ballad project S.M. The Ballad’s first album, Really Miss You will be revealed one by one.

S.M. The Ballad is expected to reveal a minute of each song featured in their album through the teaser site (smtheballad.smtown.com) on the 22nd before releasing their album.

Starting with the song Hot Times, the preview of the songs will be revealed on the teaser site every day. The album contains 5 songs and is garnering interest by the fact that Jay from Trax, Kyuhyun from Super Junior, Jonghyun from SHINee and a newcomer Jino .

On November 25th, the whole album including the title song Really Miss You will be officially released on various music sites that SM. The Ballad is expected to receive overwhelming interest.

Since S.M. The Ballad is a project where various artists can showcase their talented singing ability through the finest ballad music, many music fans are looking forward to SM The Ballad’s first album.

Really Miss You will be released on November 25th.

Source: Tvdaily

Translated by Minnie @ SUJUISM.BLOGSPOT.COM

TAKE OUT WITH FULL AND PROPER CREDITS

I really can't wait for their song and album to come out!

^ i know right! super excited for this ballad thing

wah, so many good things happen to them i'm so happy, after shindong's done with doctor champ, we're already prepared for donghae, sungmin, and siwon's drama, and sungmin's kbs one! it's just, usually they're in sbs production, and i would never thought min's gonna be brothers with jay, so cool

i read from twitter (@sinyi88, @tomozuki1 and @chiewyong) that taiwan indeed still as tight as japan so i'm grateful enough that elf manages to record audios from the concert, said yesung and kyuhyun's parents also went there,

ryeowook sang one fine spring day in chinese

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4SHJXFfZDNk

from ryeomook

while kyuhyun also sing snow flower (mika nakashima's song) in chinese, they're pleasing taiwanese elf so so much with their effort, and their food support for the concert, amazing

heechul always managed to be in the news during his stay in as guest mc in radio star

Suju Kim Heechul, the reason "Becoming a singer because of PSY?"

Idol band Suju Kim Heechul "Decided to be a singer, after seeing PSY.", attracted attention.

On the 17th broadcast of MBC <Golden Fishery-Radio Star>, guest PSY showed his extraordinary eloquence.

This day, guest MC Kim Heechul, who self-claimed as a fan of PSY, stated "At home in 2002, (while) watching television programmes with my friends, PSY appeared. After seeing PSY who was singing "Champion", (I) asked my friends "Want to try becoming a celebrity?" After which, (I) went for an audition in SM Entertainment." Therefore, having the chance to debut, specifying PSY as the one who led him in becoming a singer, surprised everyone.

Towards MC Yoon Joon Shin's question "Why did you decided to become a singer only after watching PSY?", Kim Heechul could not answer and said "I love music originally." The MCs then made a guess stating "Is it because of the mindset: 'That person is also considered as a celebrity'?", PSY became hyped up and said "I'm the one who brought huge hopes to those unspecified singers.", bringing continuous laughter in the studio.

In addition, MC Kim Gura joked and said "When I saw PSY (as a singer), I thought 'Indeed, it's the end of the world.' ", again enticing laughter in everyone.

Source: reviewstar

Chinese translation: 宝妮妮 @ i1380.com

English translation:~♡ 혁-fied @ SJ-WORLD.NET

TAKE OUT WITH FULL AND NO ADDITIONAL CREDITS.

i couldn't be happier he's there as guest mc at the right moment when psy was promoting and become a guest, somehow i think his great relationship with kim gura pitched him at the right time

thank u psy for inspired heechul to go to an audition!

i can somehow imagine him seeing this unique guy on tv and think, hey, there is a place for this kind of character (like his own character) on tv, might as well try it, even kim gura hasn't been on tv at 2002

and boy oh boy, HeeMC made in many news, isn't it, his wardrobe is like snape, or i just called him Heechulus Black, jedi master of wink

with fellow mc park so hyun

wink master

as for geng's case, many posters here said enough, the matter of dub or not is not a huge explanation since the cf concept itself is quite obvious, even if the banner's not in korean, to me, the concept just, so unwise considering he's still in court with sm, and i'm truthfully so sad that many elf bashing on kim jang hoon, somehow that feels so wrong ...

and so agree with @Jae Ho, aion has much prettier and subtle soft movement than this game portrayed in cf ... or maybe the real games is better ... bad cf then

Super Junior Super All-rounder Idol!

“Super Junior is open all year round”

Their name says it all ‘Super Junior’. 5 years since debut, hit idol group Super Junior finished their 4th album activities last June. Their 10 active members have been constantly working in many different areas.

Members Siwon, Sungmin, Donghae and Shindong all went out to become actors at the same time. Donghae (picture above) in the SBS produced drama ‘It’s alright, Daddy’s daughter’ will start greeting viewers with it’s first broadcast on November 22. Despite having a hard live, he lives with a strong sense of faith and responsibility as a youth.

KBS 2TV drama ‘President’ will start it’s broadcast on December 8 where Sungmin plays the role of Jang Sungmin, Choi Soo Jong’s son. SBS drama, ‘Athena: Goddess of War’ where Siwon transformed into a secret police, is also set to air on the same date.

Yesung and Kyuhyun broadens their stage through musicals. Yesung’s award-winning singing and acting skills in ‘Namhan Mountains’ and ‘Hong Gil Dong’ landed him a spot in ‘Spamalot: Knights of the Round Table’ performing at Seoul Arts Centre until January 2 next year. Unlike Yesung, Kyuhyun’s first musical stage, ‘The 3 Musketeers’ is set to begin on December 15 in Seoul’s Grand Theatre Hall. Kyuhyun will be playing the role of ‘D’ Artagnan’.

Leeteuk, Eunhyuk and Heechul will further their skills and show the progress to their listeners through their well-loved radio programs. Specially worth to be boastful of, Heechul will now be part of the variety program Golden Fishery’s corner, ‘Radio Star.’ Heechul successfully came out as a guest and has now become the successor of *RaSeu.

*Short for Radio Star
